thread.title: BMC election 2017 results: As it happened | Zee News
thread.title_full: BMC election 2017 results: As it happened | Zee News

title: BMC election 2017 results: As it happened | Zee News
text:
Comment 
Mumbai: The BJP on Thursday scored a resounding victory in Maharashtra civil polls emerging as the largest party in eight of the 10 municipal corporations while finishing a close second to bellicose ally Shiv Sena in the latter's Mumbai bastion. 
BJP was the number one party in Ulhasnagar, Nashik, Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Solapur, Akola, Amravati and Nagpur. Shiv Sena led the tally in Mumbai and adjoining Thane. 
Making giant strides in the Shiv Sena citadel of Mumbai, BJP won 82 seats in the fiercely fought BMC polls, just two less than the estranged saffron ally, but both were well short of the magic figure of 114 needed to control the civic body. Latest Updates 22:55 PM 
For the 25 zilla parishads, BJP led the tally, winning 397 of the 1,509 seats for which polls were held. It was followed by NCP 336, Congress 293 and Shiv Sena 259. MNS got one and others 147. Results of 76 seats still awaited. 20:42 PM 
PM Narendra Modi also congratulated CM Devendra Fadnavis and his team for the victory. I congratulate the entire team of @BJP4Maharashtra , CM @Dev_Fadnavis & @raosahebdanve for working tirelessly among the people. 
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) February 23, 2017 
20:39 PM 
Not only Mumbai mayor, but next Chief Minister will also be from Shiv Sena, says Uddhav Thackeray. Not only Mumbai mayor, but next Chief Minister will also be from Shivsena: Uddhav Thackeray pic.twitter.com/dhrH3Wr7CI 
20:36 PM 
"Our party is number 1 in Mumbai," Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said while addressing a press conference after BMC election results were declared. 20:18 PM 
BMC election results 2017: Here's the party-wise final tally. B-Mumbai MC: final:
